taskDescription:
If the area of a trapezoid equals <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>45</mn>
    </mrow>
    <mn>2</mn>
  </mfrac>
  <msup>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mtext> cm</mtext>
    </mrow>
    <mn>2</mn>
  </msup>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{{45}}{2}{\text{ cm}}^2</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msub>
      <mi>b</mi>
      <mn>1</mn>
    </msub>
  </mrow>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext> cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{b_1} = 3{\text{ cm}}</annotation></semantics></math>, and the height equals <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>h</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>5</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext> cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">h = 5{\text{ cm}}</annotation></semantics></math>, find the length of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msub>
      <mi>b</mi>
      <mn>2</mn>
    </msub>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{b_2}</annotation></semantics></math>.
